column4: what would you (anyone...) consider as a good os what im looking for is it's lightweight secure and easy to configure...
does anyone no if ubuntu runs on mac68k? motorolla cpus?
those aren't called "mac68k". anyway, no it doesn't
i no they called m68k are rather 680x0
yeah but the "m" stands for "motorola" anyway not "mac" =)
debian will run, assuming there is a 68k version - i run debian on a 486
testing always served me quite well
so not top of the line unstable and not outdated stable... seems good
yeah now there's even security updates for testing. though i guess they come quite a bit delayed
i don't use xdm (i use kdm), but i suppose there is a "Session" menu
xdm has no menu's on it's greeter
ah... all this time i've been doing sudo dpkg --configure <package>
